data.question: What is the empirical formula of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer discussed?
What is the space group of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer?
What is the role of the TAG cation in the structure of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer?
data.answer: The TAG cation engages in intermolecular hydrogen bonding with the chlorine atoms of the ligand and imposes its C3 symmetry to the structure.

data.question: What is the magnetic ordering temperature of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer?
What is the room-temperature conductivity value of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer?
True or False: The mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer crystallizes in a noncentrosymmetric space group.
What is the main difference in conductivity between oxalate-based and anilate-based Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymers?
data.answer: Anilate-based Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymers have much higher conductivity than oxalate-based ones.

data.question: True or False: The Fe(II) and Fe(III) ions are spatially distributed and disordered over the crystallographic sites at 10 K.
What model has been applied to explain the electron transport in mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymers?
True or False: The TAG cation has never been used before in such coordination polymers.
What is the coercive field of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer at 2 K?
What behavior is suggested by the initial decrease in the χmT at high temperatures for the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer?
True or False: The mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer shows semiconducting behavior.
What is the main factor determining the lower conductivity of oxalate systems compared to anilate systems?
data.answer: The difficulty to cope with the extra electron of the high-spin Fe(II) situation in oxalate systems.

data.question: True or False: The mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer has a higher in-plane conductivity compared to the perpendicular conductivity.
What is the main advantage of using the TAG cation in mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymers?
data.answer: It allows the polymer to crystallize in polar space groups, potentially leading to multiferroic properties.

data.question: True or False: The electron hopping barrier is significantly lower in anilate-based coordination polymers than in oxalate-based ones.
What is the significance of the TAG cation's C3 symmetry in the structure of the mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer?
data.answer: It contributes to the polymer's ability to form a polar trigonal space group.

data.question: True or False: The mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymer exhibits magnetic ordering.
What is the role of the anilate ligand in the conductivity of mixed-valence Fe(II)Fe(III) 2D coordination polymers?
data.answer: It acts as a buffer for the electronic rearrangement needed by the presence of the extra electron, leading to higher conductivity.
